text: Granard () is a barony in County Longford, Republic of Ireland. ==Etymology== Granard barony derives its name from the village of Granard (Irish Gránard, possibly meaning "sun height" or "corn height"). ==Location== Granard barony is located in northeastern County Longford and contains Lough Gowna and many other lakes. ==List of settlements== Below is a list of settlements in Granard barony: *Abbeylara *Ballinalee *Granard ==References== Category:Baronies of County Longford
title: Granard (barony)
